parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: The ID of the application on which to run the job.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: The client idempotency token of the job run to start. Its value must be unique for each request. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: executionRoleArn
parameters.description: The execution role ARN for the job run.

parameters.name: jobDriver
parameters.description: The job driver for the job run. sparkSubmit (dict) --- The job driver parameters specified for Spark. The entry point for the Spark submit job run. entryPointArguments (list) --- The arguments for the Spark submit job run. (string) --- sparkSubmitParameters (string) --- The parameters for the Spark submit job run. hive (dict) --- The job driver parameters specified for Hive. The query for the Hive job run. initQueryFile (string) --- The query file for the Hive job run. parameters (string) --- The parameters for the Hive job run.

nested_params.name: sparkSubmit
nested_params.description: The job driver parameters specified for Spark.

nested_params.name: entryPoint
nested_params.description: The entry point for the Spark submit job run.

nested_params.name: entryPointArguments
nested_params.description: The arguments for the Spark submit job run.

nested_params.name: sparkSubmitParameters
nested_params.description: The parameters for the Spark submit job run.

nested_params.name: hive
nested_params.description: The job driver parameters specified for Hive.

nested_params.name: query
nested_params.description: The query for the Hive job run.

nested_params.name: initQueryFile
nested_params.description: The query file for the Hive job run.

nested_params.name: parameters
nested_params.description: The parameters for the Hive job run.

parameters.name: configurationOverrides
parameters.description: The configuration overrides for the job run. applicationConfiguration (list) --- The override configurations for the application. (dict) --- A configuration specification to be used when provisioning an application. A configuration consists of a classification, properties, and optional nested configurations. A classification refers to an application-specific configuration file. Properties are the settings you want to change in that file. The classification within a configuration. properties (dict) --- A set of properties specified within a configuration classification. (string) --- (string) --- configurations (list) --- A list of additional configurations to apply within a configuration object. monitoringConfiguration (dict) --- The override configurations for monitoring. s3MonitoringConfiguration (dict) --- The Amazon S3 configuration for monitoring log publishing. logUri (string) --- The Amazon S3 destination URI for log publishing. encryptionKeyArn (string) --- The KMS key ARN to encrypt the logs published to the given Amazon S3 destination. managedPersistenceMonitoringConfiguration (dict) --- The managed log persistence configuration for a job run. enabled (boolean) --- Enables managed logging and defaults to true. If set to false, managed logging will be turned off. encryptionKeyArn (string) --- The KMS key ARN to encrypt the logs stored in managed log persistence. cloudWatchLoggingConfiguration (dict) --- The Amazon CloudWatch configuration for monitoring logs. You can configure your jobs to send log information to CloudWatch. Enables CloudWatch logging. logGroupName (string) --- The name of the log group in Amazon CloudWatch Logs where you want to publish your logs. logStreamNamePrefix (string) --- Prefix for the CloudWatch log stream name. encryptionKeyArn (string) --- The Key Management Service (KMS) key ARN to encrypt the logs that you store in CloudWatch Logs. logTypes (dict) --- The types of logs that you want to publish to CloudWatch. If you don't specify any log types, driver STDOUT and STDERR logs will be published to CloudWatch Logs by default. For more information including the supported worker types for Hive and Spark, see Logging for EMR Serverless with CloudWatch. Key Valid Values: SPARK_DRIVER, SPARK_EXECUTOR, HIVE_DRIVER, TEZ_TASK Array Members Valid Values: STDOUT, STDERR, HIVE_LOG, TEZ_AM, SYSTEM_LOGS (string) --- Worker type for an analytics framework. (list) --- (string) --- Log type for a Spark/Hive job-run. prometheusMonitoringConfiguration (dict) --- The monitoring configuration object you can configure to send metrics to Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus for a job run. remoteWriteUrl (string) --- The remote write URL in the Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus workspace to send metrics to.

nested_params.name: applicationConfiguration
nested_params.description: The override configurations for the application.

nested_params.name: classification
nested_params.description: The classification within a configuration.

nested_params.description: A set of properties specified within a configuration classification.

nested_params.name: encryptionKeyArn
nested_params.description: The KMS key ARN to encrypt the logs published to the given Amazon S3 destination.

nested_params.name: managedPersistenceMonitoringConfiguration
nested_params.description: The managed log persistence configuration for a job run.

nested_params.name: enabled
nested_params.description: Enables managed logging and defaults to true. If set to false, managed logging will be turned off.

nested_params.name: encryptionKeyArn
nested_params.description: The KMS key ARN to encrypt the logs stored in managed log persistence.

nested_params.name: cloudWatchLoggingConfiguration
nested_params.description: The Amazon CloudWatch configuration for monitoring logs. You can configure your jobs to send log information to CloudWatch.

nested_params.name: enabled
nested_params.description: Enables CloudWatch logging.

nested_params.name: logGroupName
nested_params.description: The name of the log group in Amazon CloudWatch Logs where you want to publish your logs.

nested_params.name: logStreamNamePrefix
nested_params.description: Prefix for the CloudWatch log stream name.

nested_params.name: encryptionKeyArn
nested_params.description: The Key Management Service (KMS) key ARN to encrypt the logs that you store in CloudWatch Logs.

nested_params.name: logTypes
nested_params.description: The types of logs that you want to publish to CloudWatch. If you don't specify any log types, driver STDOUT and STDERR logs will be published to CloudWatch Logs by default. For more information including the supported worker types for Hive and Spark, see Logging for EMR Serverless with CloudWatch.

nested_params.description: The monitoring configuration object you can configure to send metrics to Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus for a job run.

nested_params.name: remoteWriteUrl
nested_params.description: The remote write URL in the Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus workspace to send metrics to.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: The tags assigned to the job run. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: retryPolicy
parameters.description: The retry policy when job run starts. maxAttempts (integer) --- Maximum number of attempts for the job run. This parameter is only applicable for BATCH mode. maxFailedAttemptsPerHour (integer) --- Maximum number of failed attempts per hour. This [arameter is only applicable for STREAMING mode.

nested_params.name: maxAttempts
nested_params.description: Maximum number of attempts for the job run. This parameter is only applicable for BATCH mode.

nested_params.name: maxFailedAttemptsPerHour
nested_params.description: Maximum number of failed attempts per hour. This [arameter is only applicable for STREAMING mode.

nested_items.name: applicationId
nested_items.description: This output displays the application ID on which the job run was submitted.

nested_items.name: jobRunId
nested_items.description: The output contains the ID of the started job run.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: This output displays the ARN of the job run..
